result.execSummary:
The defendant Denan S Marquardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA and comply with any recommendations

records.addlTxt: from Jacki Gackstatter, Rock County Clerk of Court, stating defendant has graduated from Rock County  Drug Treatment Court. Copies of minutes from defendant's Drug Court hearings enclosed.
Order to change the restitution payee to Donald Klamer
Order to change the restitution to Donald Klamer.

10:47 AM Defendant, Denan S Marquardt, appeared pro se. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he has not paid anything toward restitution, stated he is working two jobs. Defendant will start making monthly payments.
copy of District Attorney's office letter to dispatch canceling warrant

01:46 PM Defendant, Denan S Marquardt, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant didn't know he had anything happening in a closed case.  Warrant quashed. Notice in hand given for September 30 motion hearing.
Motion hearing on September 30, 2019 at 10:45 am.

10:16 A.M., Defendant Denan S Marquardt in court, in custody with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, D.K., K.P., M.K., C.K., makes statements re: victim, K.M., H.B., N.M., makes statements re: defendant, Atty Long gives recommendation, Atty Frank gives recommendation, Court sentences defendant to: 12 years prison, 2 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision, $518.00 costs, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, AODA and comply, $13,913.00 Restitution plus surcharge Joint/Several, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substances Abuse Program, 355 days sentence credit, sentence to commence forthwith, 11:39 A.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
